description.narrative: Support the implementation of the National Public Administration Reform (PAR) Strategy, with technical assistance through the establishment of the Public Administration Reform Fund- second phase.
Support the implementation of the National Public Administration Reform (PAR) Strategy, with technical assistance through the establishment of the Public Administration Reform Fund- second phase.

The Public Administration Reform Coordinators Office (PARCO) was established by the Decision on establishment of a PARCO with the Office of the Chairman of the Council of Ministers of Bosnia and Herzegovina in 2004. The function of the Public Administration Reform Coordinator was established in order to implement common Avslutspromemoria Completion Memo Contribution ID: 76004213 2 (6) policies and procedures of competent authorities in Bosnia and Herzegovina in the area of public administration reform as well as to ensure effective coordination of activities set forth in applicable laws in Bosnia and Herzegovina, for which different institutions in the country are responsible. The core responsibilities of the Office defined by the Decision are: coordination of activities related to the preparation, adoption and implementation of the Public Administration Reform Strategy. The Public Administration Reform Fund (PARF) is a joint financial initiative that brings together financial resources of the donors and contributions of the state, the entities and Brko District of BiH (BD). The Public Administration Reform Fund was established in 2007 by signing the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) for Establishment of the Public Administration Reform Fund between the United Kingdom Department for International Development, the Swedish International Development Cooperation Agency, the Netherlands Ministry of Development Cooperation, the Delegation of the European Union to Bosnia and Herzegovina and the Council of Ministers of Bosnia and Herzegovina, Government of the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina, Government of the Republika Srpska, Government of Brko District of Bosnia and Herzegovina and the Ministry of Finance and Treasury of Bosnia and Herzegovina. The Fund has been joined by the Norway Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Annex III to the Memorandum) and the Denmark Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Annex IV to the Memorandum). Annex III defined the obligation of the national authorities at all levels of government to finance the PAR Fund. The budget of the Coordinators Office is treated as a contribution of Bosnia and Herzegovina to PAR implementation. Amendments to the Memorandum have been effected by signing annexes to the Memorandum (a total of five annexes have been signed), following a prior procedure conducted in accordance with the Law on the Conclusion and Implementation of International Agreements. The general goal of the Memorandum is to provide a harmonised approach to supporting the implementation of projects across Bosnia and Herzegovina that are within the framework defined by the PAR Strategy. Apart from the section concerning the terms of duration that were renewed by annexes, the Memorandum has proven to be a good framework for the operation of the PAR Fund during the previous period, and its provisions have for the most part provided for a smooth decision-making process. The Memorandum has established a Management Board of the PAR Fund to organise coordination among MoU signatories. The Management Board supervises the use of donor funds. The method of operation of the Management Board is defined by the MoU and the Rules of Procedure of the PAR Fund. In accordance with the MoU, PARCO is responsible for preparing and chairing sessions; for identifying, considering, developing and drafting project specifications; and for monitoring and evaluation of projects. In addition, PARCO is in charge of the implementation of procurement procedure in accordance with the Law on Public Procurement of Bosnia and Herzegovina; preparation and submission of materials for approval to the Management Board; preparation of reports and provision to the PAR Fund Management Board of information relevant for PAR Strategy implementation and projects funded as part of the Strategy; as well as for informing the Management Board Avslutspromemoria Completion Memo Contribution ID: 76004213 3 (6) regarding all circumstances that may interfere with or threaten successful implementation of the PAR Strategy. The PAR Fund has been a key driver of the public administration reform processes and it is owing to the PAR Fund, despite the lengthy procedures dictated by the complex political environment, that a significant progress has been made in the process of public administration reform. Despite the gaps identified through various independent audits of the PAR Fund operation, this single instrument in Bosnia and Herzegovina for the implementation of common policies of the governments in Bosnia and Herzegovina was an indispensable instrument for the financing of public administration reform processes and the meeting of accession requirements in this area.

sector.narrative: Public sector policy and administrative management

No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published

sida:strategy.sida:title: Reform cooperation with Eastern Europe, the Western Balkans and Turkey 2014-2021
sida:strategy.sida:titleSV: Reformsamarbete med Östeuropa, Västra Balkan och Turkiet 2014-2021
